sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A={1,2,3} and B={2,3,4}. Find the value of (A△B)×A and (B△A)×A, then prove that (A△B)×A is not equal to (B△A)×A, showing that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
